persons.name: Jean HenriHassenfratz
persons.description: First Professor of Physics at the École polytechnique, Paris, and mine inspector.

persons.name: JohnWoodward
persons.description: Natural philospher with an interest in geology. His collection of fossils and minerals is part of Cambridge University's Sedgwick Museum of Geology. FRSL.

persons.name: JosephPriestley
persons.description: Unitarian and political radical forced into exile in Pennsylvania. As a natural philospher and chemist who retained belief in phlogiston, he discovered oxygen and nitrous oxide though not under those names. FRSL.

persons.name: JohnBillingsley
persons.description: Wrote the Somerset volume for the Board of Agriculture county surveys. A founder of the Bath and West of England Society of which Davy was elected an honorary member in 1804.

persons.name: AllanMaconochie
persons.description: Lord Meadowbank from 1796. Scottish advocate and a founder of the Royal Society of Edinburgh.

persons.name: Robert WIlliamesVaughan
persons.description: Welsh landowner, second baronet and Tory MP for Merioneth, 1792-1836. Davy seems to have stayed with him in the summer of 1805.

places.name: England
places.description: England is a country that is part of the United Kingdom. It is located on the island of Great Britain, of which it covers approximately 62%, and over 100 smaller adjacent islands.

places.name: Somerset
places.description: A county in south-west England.

persons.name: Nicolas-Théodore deSaussure
persons.description: Swiss chemist and student of plant physiology who made seminal advances in phytochemistry. ForMemRSL.

persons.name: JamesCooke
persons.description: Cooke or Cook. Anglican minister of Ardwick (near Manchester). Author of Drill Husbandry Perfected.

persons.name: AndrewCoventry
persons.description: First Professor of Agriculture at the University of Edinburgh from 1790 until death.

persons.name: ArthurYoung
persons.description: Agricultural writer and Secretary to the Board of Agriculture. FRSL.

persons.name: Louis BernardGuyton de Morveau
persons.description: French chemist and revolutionary politician who is credited with producing the first systematic method of chemical nomenclature. ForMemRSL.

persons.name: Louis NicolasVauquelin
persons.description: French pharmacist and chemist who met Davy in Paris in 1813. ForMemRSL.

persons.name: JohnPringle
persons.description: Physician who served as President of the Royal Society of London, 1772-1778. Created a baronet. FRSL.

places.name: Cornwall
places.description: Cornwall is a county in south-west England, birthplace of Humphry Davy.

persons.name: RichardWatson
persons.description: Professor of Chemisty at Cambridge University, 1764-1773 and Bishop of Llandaff , 1782-1816. FRSL

persons.name: GeorgePearson
persons.description: Physician and chemist who introduced a new systematic nomenclature for inorganic chemistry in English based on that devised by French chemists and confirmed the effacy of vaccination. FRSL.

places.name: Bedfordshire
places.description: A county in the east of England. The county town is Bedford.

persons.name: Charles WilliamBury
persons.description: Irish landowner and politician, 1st Earl of Charleville from 1806. Was connected to both the Royal Institution and the Board of Agriculture. FRSL.

places.name: Berkshire
places.description: Berkshire is a county in south-east England.

places.name: Hampshire
places.description: Hampshire is a county in southern England.

places.name: Loch Ness
places.description: Loch Ness is a large freshwater loch in the Scottish Highlands.

persons.name: CharlesDundas
persons.description: Scottish born politician who sat for a number of seats. Created Baron Amesbury just before his death, he was involved with the Board of Agriculture.

persons.name: GeorgePearson
persons.description: Physician and chemist who introduced a new systematic nomenclature for inorganic chemistry in English based on that devised by French chemists and confirmed the effacy of vaccination. FRSL.

places.name: Newbury, Berkshire
places.description: Newbury is a market town in the county of Berkshire, England.

persons.name: JosephPriestley
persons.description: Unitarian and political radical forced into exile in Pennsylvania. As a natural philospher and chemist who retained belief in phlogiston, he discovered oxygen and nitrous oxide though not under those names. FRSL.

persons.name: John BakerHolroyd
persons.description: Independent-minded MP; from 1802 1st Baron Sheffield and from 1816 1st Earl of Sheffield. President of the Board of Agriculture, 1802-1806. During autumn 1803 Davy stayed with him for three weeks at his Sussex seat, Sheffield Place. FRSL.

persons.name: WilliamMontagu
persons.description: From 1788 fifth Duke of Manchester. Army officer, Ordinary Member of the Board of Agriculture and later Governor of Jamacia. Davy cited his agricultural work in Elements of Agricultural Chemistry

places.name: Woburn
places.description: Davy mentions Priestley Bog and meadow near Woburn in Elements of Agricultural Chemistry p. 265.
